rDir = random.choice(["+z","-z","+y","-y","+x","-x"]) FDir = random.choice(["+z","-z","+y","-y","+x","-x"])
def dir2vec(dir):
translator = { "+x" : [1,0,0], "-x" : [-1,0,0], "+y" : [0,1,0], "-y" : [0,-1,0], "+z" : [0,0,1], "-z" : [0,0,-1] }
return translator[dir]
def vec2dir(vec):
translator = { [1,0,0] : "+x", [-1,0,0] : "-x", [0,1,0] : "+y", [0,-1,0] : "-y", [0,0,1] : "+z", [0,0,-1] : "-z" }
return translator[vec]
def crossprod(vec1, vec2): vec3 = [0,0,0]
vec3[0] = vec1[1]*vec2[2] - vec1[2]*vec2[1] vec3[1] = vec1[0]*vec2[2] - vec1[2]*vec2[0] vec3[2] = vec1[0]*vec2[1] - vec1[1]*vec2[0]
return vec3
def dotprod(vec1, vec2):
return vec1[0]*vec2[0] + vec1[1]*vec2[1] + vec1[2]*vec2[2]

Consider the torque on this object as measured from its center of mass. What is the direction of that torque? (Type +x, -x etc. If there is no torque, write none.)
